Join

Students! Join a community of over 2,350 fellow students and graduates across the world.
Join BEN

Member BENefits

Community

Be a part of a growing, non-profit grassroots organization run by students and graduates for students and graduates. Access to an online community of over 2,350 plus students and recent graduates from around the world. Region channels for your country, region, and even city.

Events

Free/discounted tickets to BEN partner conferences, workshops, hackathons, and bootcamps. Also access to BEN hosted events like airdrops, Blockchain Madness, Blockchain Education Month, Blockchain Startup Gauntlet, Hackathons, and AMAs with CEOs, founders, developers, and teams,

Opportunities

Opportunities to volunteer and intern, so you can build resume/portfolio and grow your network. Get matched with BEN partner companies based on your interests, preferences, and even work style (full-time, part-time, local work, remote work)

Companies Our Students Have Joined

Success Stories

Akarsh Agarwal
Nirma University '17

Thank you to the Blockchain Education Network, MIT Bitcoin Club, and MIT Digital Currency Initiative for making my dream come true by sponsoring five students from India to attend the MIT Bitcoin Expo.

The struggles each student faced to get to the Expo seemed insurmountable with visas, embassies, and flights. But thanks to BEN we pulled through. The fire to build community, continue learning, and build a decentralized world burns within us.

Jessie Xiong
University of Delaware '17

Through shared experiences online and in person, engaging with other BEN students changed me for the better. I would not have been exposed to any of my current influences, role models, and mentors if it wasnâ€™t for the Blockchain Education Network.

Kevin Leffew
Wake Forest University '17

As the founder of an organization at Wake Forest University, BEN enabled me to connnect with like-minded students across the globe. Online discussions at BEN around decentralized technologies led to relationships which carried through in to my career.

I appreciate the support BEN brought to Wake Forest, especially through Wake Fintech and the Blockfest Events, which hosted speakers from Microsoft, Consensys, and Storj Labs.
